metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Focus

Focus is a force multiplier on work.

Almost everyone I’ve ever met would be well-served by spending more time thinking about what to focus on

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: It is much more important to work on the right thing than it is to work many hours

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Most people waste most of their time on stuff that doesn’t matter.

Once you have figured out what to do, be unstoppable about getting your small handful of priorities accomplished quickly

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
I have yet to meet a slow-moving person who is very successful.

7

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Work hard

You can get to about the 90th percentile in your field by working either smart or hard, which is still a great accomplishment

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
But getting to the 99th percentile requires both—you will be competing with other very talented people who will have great ideas and be willing to work a lot.

Extreme people get extreme results

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Working a lot comes with huge life trade-offs, and it’s perfectly rational to decide not to do it

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: But it has a lot of advantages

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
As in most cases, momentum compounds, and success begets success.

And it’s often really fun

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: One of the great joys in life is finding your purpose, excelling at it, and discovering that your impact matters to something larger than yourself

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: A YC founder recently expressed great surprise about how much happier and more fulfilled he was after leaving his job at a big company and working towards his maximum possible impact

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Working hard at that should be celebrated

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
It’s not entirely clear to me why working hard has become a Bad Thing in certain parts of the US, but this is certainly not the case in other parts of the world—the amount of energy and drive exhibited by entrepreneurs outside of the US is quickly becoming the new benchmark.

You have to figure out how to work hard without burning out

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
People find their own strategies for this, but one that almost always works is to find work you like doing with people you enjoy spending a lot of time with.

I think people who pretend you can be super successful professionally without working most of the time (for some period of your life) are doing a disservice

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
In fact, work stamina seems to be one of the biggest predictors of long-term success.

One more thought about working hard: do it at the beginning of your career

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Hard work compounds like interest, and the earlier you do it, the more time you have for the benefits to pay off

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
It’s also easier to work hard when you have fewer other responsibilities, which is frequently but not always the case when you’re young.

8

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Be bold

I believe that it’s easier to do a hard startup than an easy startup

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
People want to be part of something exciting and feel that their work matters.

If you are making progress on an important problem, you will have a constant tailwind of people wanting to help you

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Let yourself grow more ambitious, and don’t be afraid to work on what you really want to work on.

If everyone else is starting meme companies, and you want to start a gene-editing company, then do that and don’t second guess it.

Follow your curiosity

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Things that seem exciting to you will often seem exciting to other people too.

9

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Be willful

A big secret is that you can bend the world to your will a surprising percentage of the time—most people don’t even try, and just accept that things are the way that they are.

People have an enormous capacity to make things happen

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
A combination of self-doubt, giving up too early, and not pushing hard enough prevents most people from ever reaching anywhere near their potential.

Ask for what you want

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: You usually won’t get it, and often the rejection will be painful

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
But when this works, it works surprisingly well.

Almost always, the people who say “I am going to keep going until this works, and no matter what the challenges are I’m going to figure them out”, and mean it, go on to succeed

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
They are persistent long enough to give themselves a chance for luck to go their way.

Airbnb is my benchmark for this

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
There are so many stories they tell that I wouldn’t recommend trying to reproduce (keeping maxed-out credit cards in those nine-slot three-ring binder pages kids use for baseball cards, eating dollar store cereal for every meal, battle after battle with powerful entrenched interest, and on and on) but they managed to survive long enough for luck to go their way.

To be willful, you have to be optimistic—hopefully this is a personality trait that can be improved with practice

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
I have never met a very successful pessimistic person.

10

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Be hard to compete with

Most people understand that companies are more valuable if they are difficult to compete with

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
This is important, and obviously true.

But this holds true for you as an individual as well

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
If what you do can be done by someone else, it eventually will be, and for less money.

The best way to become difficult to compete with is to build up leverage

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: For example, you can do it with personal relationships, by building a strong personal brand, or by getting good at the intersection of multiple different fields

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
There are many other strategies, but you have to figure out some way to do it.

Most people do whatever most people they hang out with do

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
This mimetic behavior is usually a mistake—if you’re doing the same thing everyone else is doing, you will not be hard to compete with.

11

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Build a network

Great work requires teams

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Developing a network of talented people to work with—sometimes closely, sometimes loosely—is an essential part of a great career

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
The size of the network of really talented people you know often becomes the limiter for what you can accomplish.

An effective way to build a network is to help people as much as you can

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Doing this, over a long period of time, is what lead to most of my best career opportunities and three of my four best investments

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
I’m continually surprised how often something good happens to me because of something I did to help a founder ten years ago.

One of the best ways to build a network is to develop a reputation for really taking care of the people who work with you

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Be overly generous with sharing the upside; it will come back to you 10x

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Also, learn how to evaluate what people are great at, and put them in those roles

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
(This is the most important thing I have learned about management, and I haven’t read much about it.) You want to have a reputation for pushing people hard enough that they accomplish more than they thought they could, but not so hard they burn out.

Everyone is better at some things than others

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Define yourself by your strengths, not your weaknesses

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Acknowledge your weaknesses and figure out how to work around them, but don’t let them stop you from doing what you want to do

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: “I can’t do X because I’m not good at Y” is something I hear from entrepreneurs surprisingly often, and almost always reflects a lack of creativity

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
The best way to make up for your weaknesses is to hire complementary team members instead of just hiring people who are good at the same things you are.

A particularly valuable part of building a network is to get good at discovering undiscovered talent

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Quickly spotting intelligence, drive, and creativity gets much easier with practice

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: The easiest way to learn is just to meet a lot of people, and keep track of who goes on to impress you and who doesn’t

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Remember that you are mostly looking for rate of improvement, and don’t overvalue experience or current accomplishment.

I try to always ask myself when I meet someone new “is this person a force of nature?” It’s a pretty good heuristic for finding people who are likely to accomplish great things.

A special case of developing a network is finding someone eminent to take a bet on you, ideally early in your career

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: The best way to do this, no surprise, is to go out of your way to be helpful

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
(And remember that you have to pay this forward at some point later!)

Finally, remember to spend your time with positive people who support your ambitions.

12

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
You get rich by owning things

The biggest economic misunderstanding of my childhood was that people got rich from high salaries

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Though there are some exceptions—entertainers for example —almost no one in the history of the Forbes list has gotten there with a salary.

You get truly rich by owning things that increase rapidly in value.

This can be a piece of a business, real estate, natural resource, intellectual property, or other similar things

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: But somehow or other, you need to own equity in something, instead of just selling your time

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Time only scales linearly.

The best way to make things that increase rapidly in value is by making things people want at scale.

13

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Be internally driven

Most people are primarily externally driven; they do what they do because they want to impress other people

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
This is bad for many reasons, but here are two important ones.

First, you will work on consensus ideas and on consensus career tracks

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: You will care a lot—much more than you realize—if other people think you’re doing the right thing

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
This will probably prevent you from doing truly interesting work, and even if you do, someone else would have done it anyway.

Second, you will usually get risk calculations wrong

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
You’ll be very focused on keeping up with other people and not falling behind in competitive games, even in the short term.

Smart people seem to be especially at risk of such externally-driven behavior

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Being aware of it helps, but only a little—you will likely have to work super-hard to not fall in the mimetic trap.

The most successful people I know are primarily internally driven; they do what they do to impress themselves and because they feel compelled to make something happen in the world

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
After you’ve made enough money to buy whatever you want and gotten enough social status that it stops being fun to get more, this is the only force I know of that will continue to drive you to higher levels of performance.

This is why the question of a person’s motivation is so important

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: It’s the first thing I try to understand about someone

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
The right motivations are hard to define a set of rules for, but you know it when you see it.

Jessica Livingston and Paul Graham are my benchmarks for this

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence:
[3]

The reason I've spent so long establishing this rather obvious point is that it leads to another that many people will find shocking

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: YC was widely mocked for the first few years, and almost no one thought it would be a big success when they first started

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words

metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Now I try to always listen to it with the assumption that it’s true, and then decide if I want to act on it or not

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Truth-seeking is hard and often painful, but it is what separates self-belief from self-delusion.

This balance also helps you avoid coming across as entitled and out of touch.

3

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Learn to think independently

Entrepreneurship is very difficult to teach because original thinking is very difficult to teach

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: School is not set up to teach this—in fact, it generally rewards the opposite

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
So you have to cultivate it on your own.

Thinking from first principles and trying to generate new ideas is fun, and finding people to exchange them with is a great way to get better at this

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
The next step is to find easy, fast ways to test these ideas in the real world.

“I will fail many times, and I will be really right once” is the entrepreneurs’ way

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
You have to give yourself a lot of chances to get lucky.

One of the most powerful lessons to learn is that you can figure out what to do in situations that seem to have no solution

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: The more times you do this, the more you will believe it

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Grit comes from learning you can get back up after you get knocked down.

4

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Get good at “sales”

Self-belief alone is not sufficient—you also have to be able to convince other people of what you believe.

All great careers, to some degree, become sales jobs

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: You have to evangelize your plans to customers, prospective employees, the press, investors, etc

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
This requires an inspiring vision, strong communication skills, some degree of charisma, and evidence of execution ability.

Getting good at communication—particularly written communication—is an investment worth making

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
My best advice for communicating clearly is to first make sure your thinking is clear and then use plain, concise language.

The best way to be good at sales is to genuinely believe in what you’re selling

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Selling what you truly believe in feels great, and trying to sell snake oil feels awful.

Getting good at sales is like improving at any other skill—anyone can get better at it with deliberate practice

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
But for some reason, perhaps because it feels distasteful, many people treat it as something unlearnable.

My other big sales tip is to show up in person whenever it’s important

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: When I was first starting out, I was always willing to get on a plane

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
It was frequently unnecessary, but three times it led to career-making turning points for me that otherwise would have gone the other way.

5

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Make it easy to take risks

Most people overestimate risk and underestimate reward

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Taking risks is important because it’s impossible to be right all the time—you have to try many things and adapt quickly as you learn more.

It’s often easier to take risks early in your career; you don’t have much to lose, and you potentially have a lot to gain

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Once you’ve gotten yourself to a point where you have your basic obligations covered you should try to make it easy to take risks

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Look for small bets you can make where you lose 1x if you’re wrong but make 100x if it works

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Then make a bigger bet in that direction.

Don’t save up for too long, though

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: At YC, we’ve often noticed a problem with founders that have spent a lot of time working at Google or Facebook

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: When people get used to a comfortable life, a predictable job, and a reputation of succeeding at whatever they do, it gets very hard to leave that behind (and people have an incredible ability to always match their lifestyle to next year’s salary)

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Even if they do leave, the temptation to return is great

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: It’s easy—and human nature—to prioritize short-term gain and convenience over long-term fulfillment

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: But when you aren’t on the treadmill, you can follow your hunches and spend time on things that might turn out to be really interesting

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Keeping your life cheap and flexible for as long as you can is a powerful way to do this, but obviously comes with tradeoffs.

6

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Focus

Focus is a force multiplier on work.

Almost everyone I’ve ever met would be well-served by spending more time thinking about what to focus on

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: It is much more important to work on the right thing than it is to work many hours

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Most people waste most of their time on stuff that doesn’t matter.

Once you have figured out what to do, be unstoppable about getting your small handful of priorities accomplished quickly

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
I have yet to meet a slow-moving person who is very successful.

7

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Work hard

You can get to about the 90th percentile in your field by working either smart or hard, which is still a great accomplishment

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
But getting to the 99th percentile requires both—you will be competing with other very talented people who will have great ideas and be willing to work a lot.

Extreme people get extreme results

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Working a lot comes with huge life trade-offs, and it’s perfectly rational to decide not to do it

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: But it has a lot of advantages

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
As in most cases, momentum compounds, and success begets success.

And it’s often really fun

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: One of the great joys in life is finding your purpose, excelling at it, and discovering that your impact matters to something larger than yourself

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: A YC founder recently expressed great surprise about how much happier and more fulfilled he was after leaving his job at a big company and working towards his maximum possible impact

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Working hard at that should be celebrated

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
It’s not entirely clear to me why working hard has become a Bad Thing in certain parts of the US, but this is certainly not the case in other parts of the world—the amount of energy and drive exhibited by entrepreneurs outside of the US is quickly becoming the new benchmark.

You have to figure out how to work hard without burning out

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
People find their own strategies for this, but one that almost always works is to find work you like doing with people you enjoy spending a lot of time with.

I think people who pretend you can be super successful professionally without working most of the time (for some period of your life) are doing a disservice

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
In fact, work stamina seems to be one of the biggest predictors of long-term success.

One more thought about working hard: do it at the beginning of your career

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Hard work compounds like interest, and the earlier you do it, the more time you have for the benefits to pay off

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
It’s also easier to work hard when you have fewer other responsibilities, which is frequently but not always the case when you’re young.

8

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Be bold

I believe that it’s easier to do a hard startup than an easy startup

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
People want to be part of something exciting and feel that their work matters.

If you are making progress on an important problem, you will have a constant tailwind of people wanting to help you

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Let yourself grow more ambitious, and don’t be afraid to work on what you really want to work on.

If everyone else is starting meme companies, and you want to start a gene-editing company, then do that and don’t second guess it.

Follow your curiosity

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Things that seem exciting to you will often seem exciting to other people too.

9

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Be willful

A big secret is that you can bend the world to your will a surprising percentage of the time—most people don’t even try, and just accept that things are the way that they are.

People have an enormous capacity to make things happen

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
A combination of self-doubt, giving up too early, and not pushing hard enough prevents most people from ever reaching anywhere near their potential.

Ask for what you want

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: You usually won’t get it, and often the rejection will be painful

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
But when this works, it works surprisingly well.

Almost always, the people who say “I am going to keep going until this works, and no matter what the challenges are I’m going to figure them out”, and mean it, go on to succeed

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
They are persistent long enough to give themselves a chance for luck to go their way.

Airbnb is my benchmark for this

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
There are so many stories they tell that I wouldn’t recommend trying to reproduce (keeping maxed-out credit cards in those nine-slot three-ring binder pages kids use for baseball cards, eating dollar store cereal for every meal, battle after battle with powerful entrenched interest, and on and on) but they managed to survive long enough for luck to go their way.

To be willful, you have to be optimistic—hopefully this is a personality trait that can be improved with practice

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
I have never met a very successful pessimistic person.

10

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Be hard to compete with

Most people understand that companies are more valuable if they are difficult to compete with

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
This is important, and obviously true.

But this holds true for you as an individual as well

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
If what you do can be done by someone else, it eventually will be, and for less money.

The best way to become difficult to compete with is to build up leverage

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: For example, you can do it with personal relationships, by building a strong personal brand, or by getting good at the intersection of multiple different fields

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
There are many other strategies, but you have to figure out some way to do it.

Most people do whatever most people they hang out with do

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
This mimetic behavior is usually a mistake—if you’re doing the same thing everyone else is doing, you will not be hard to compete with.

11

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Build a network

Great work requires teams

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Developing a network of talented people to work with—sometimes closely, sometimes loosely—is an essential part of a great career

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
The size of the network of really talented people you know often becomes the limiter for what you can accomplish.

An effective way to build a network is to help people as much as you can

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Doing this, over a long period of time, is what lead to most of my best career opportunities and three of my four best investments

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
I’m continually surprised how often something good happens to me because of something I did to help a founder ten years ago.

One of the best ways to build a network is to develop a reputation for really taking care of the people who work with you

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Be overly generous with sharing the upside; it will come back to you 10x

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Also, learn how to evaluate what people are great at, and put them in those roles

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
(This is the most important thing I have learned about management, and I haven’t read much about it.) You want to have a reputation for pushing people hard enough that they accomplish more than they thought they could, but not so hard they burn out.

Everyone is better at some things than others

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Define yourself by your strengths, not your weaknesses

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Acknowledge your weaknesses and figure out how to work around them, but don’t let them stop you from doing what you want to do

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: “I can’t do X because I’m not good at Y” is something I hear from entrepreneurs surprisingly often, and almost always reflects a lack of creativity

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
The best way to make up for your weaknesses is to hire complementary team members instead of just hiring people who are good at the same things you are.

A particularly valuable part of building a network is to get good at discovering undiscovered talent

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: Quickly spotting intelligence, drive, and creativity gets much easier with practice

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: The easiest way to learn is just to meet a lot of people, and keep track of who goes on to impress you and who doesn’t

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Remember that you are mostly looking for rate of improvement, and don’t overvalue experience or current accomplishment.

I try to always ask myself when I meet someone new “is this person a force of nature?” It’s a pretty good heuristic for finding people who are likely to accomplish great things.

A special case of developing a network is finding someone eminent to take a bet on you, ideally early in your career

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: The best way to do this, no surprise, is to go out of your way to be helpful

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
(And remember that you have to pay this forward at some point later!)

Finally, remember to spend your time with positive people who support your ambitions.

12

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
You get rich by owning things

The biggest economic misunderstanding of my childhood was that people got rich from high salaries

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Though there are some exceptions—entertainers for example —almost no one in the history of the Forbes list has gotten there with a salary.

You get truly rich by owning things that increase rapidly in value.

This can be a piece of a business, real estate, natural resource, intellectual property, or other similar things

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: But somehow or other, you need to own equity in something, instead of just selling your time

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Time only scales linearly.

The best way to make things that increase rapidly in value is by making things people want at scale.

13

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Be internally driven

Most people are primarily externally driven; they do what they do because they want to impress other people

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
This is bad for many reasons, but here are two important ones.

First, you will work on consensus ideas and on consensus career tracks

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: You will care a lot—much more than you realize—if other people think you’re doing the right thing

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
This will probably prevent you from doing truly interesting work, and even if you do, someone else would have done it anyway.

Second, you will usually get risk calculations wrong

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
You’ll be very focused on keeping up with other people and not falling behind in competitive games, even in the short term.

Smart people seem to be especially at risk of such externally-driven behavior

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
Being aware of it helps, but only a little—you will likely have to work super-hard to not fall in the mimetic trap.

The most successful people I know are primarily internally driven; they do what they do to impress themselves and because they feel compelled to make something happen in the world

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
After you’ve made enough money to buy whatever you want and gotten enough social status that it stops being fun to get more, this is the only force I know of that will continue to drive you to higher levels of performance.

This is why the question of a person’s motivation is so important

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence: It’s the first thing I try to understand about someone

metadata.author: Paul Graham
metadata.title: Putting Ideas Into Words
metadata.sentence: Ideas can feel complete

metadata.author: Sam Altman
metadata.title: How To Be Successful
metadata.sentence:
The right motivations are hard to define a set of rules for, but you know it when you see it.
